title: Rewterz Threat Alert IcedID Banking Trojan Active IOCs Russian-Ukrainian Cyber Warfare

sentences: IcedID, aka BokBot a banking trojan first appeared in 2017. The threat actor behind IcedID is Lunar Spider. The main purpose of this trojan is to steal financial information but aside from this, it is also a passage for a RAT. Initially, it was delivered as a later-stage payload from multiple threats including Emotet, TrickBot, and Hancitor. Recently, it is observed that its threat actors are using several new techniques to avoid detection by the sandbox and endpoint security. This trojan has capabilities similar to Zeus, Dridex, and Gozi (financial threats). IcedID can download different additional modules and a configuration file from C2. It performs its task of stealing information by deploying a man-in-the-browser attack which assists in gaining banking credentials.
titles: Rewterz Threat Alert IcedID Banking Trojan Active IOCs Russian-Ukrainian Cyber Warfare

sentences: The government team for responding to computer emergencies in Ukraine CERT-UA revealed the fact of mass distribution among citizens of Ukraine XLS-documents called Mobilization Register.xls.
